sentences.sContent: It’ll be awkward getting cars in and out.
sentences.sCn: 这样汽车就不好进出了。

sentences.sContent: The new financial arrangements were awkward to manage.
sentences.sCn: 新的财务安排不好操作。

sentences.sContent: A good carpenter can make a cupboard to fit the most awkward space.
sentences.sCn: 就算是再尴尬的空间，好木匠也能做一个合适的橱柜。

sentences.sContent: She was afraid he was going to ask an awkward question.
sentences.sCn: 她担心他会问出不好回答的问题。

synos.tran: 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

remMethod.val: “拗口的” → 笨拙的， 难用的

trans.tranCn: 笨拙的； 难用的； 不便的
trans.tranOther: difficult to do, use, or deal with
